intro: Pronephrium celebicum, commonly known as the Celebes pronephrium, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest undergrowth. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Pronephrium celebicum is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
